title: Defeated New Zealand coach Steve Hansen pays tribute to England and their style: 'It's simple but beautiful'
text:
New Zealand’s coach Steve Hansen has called England’s style of play “simplistic but beautiful” and praised Eddie Jones’ team for “working their butts off” to reach Saturday’s World Cup final.

Speaking the day after England’s 19-7 win Hansen, who had a post-match drink with Jones on Saturday night, said: “They don’t play a sophisticated game: win the ball, give it to the big bloke and run hard. Win that collision. It’s rugby in a simplistic form but it’s beautiful in the same sentence.

“They use their big man. When you win that collision you go forward. And the game has never changed from the first time it was ever played until the last time it was ever played. The team that goes forward will...
description: New Zealand’s coach Steve Hansen has called England’s style of play “simplistic but beautiful” and praised Eddie Jones’ team for “working their butts off” to reach Saturday’s World Cup final.
